channel.title: Poem on Poryland
channel.description: Recent content in Poem on Poryland

item.title: Wanted
item.description: She’s run from our town, bad child. Stop any means of transport and look for her! Where has she one? If you’ve seen any sight of her; a fragment of her ripped white robe,

item.title: The Revolutionary War
item.description: British and America declared war, on 1775 one day before April’s 20th That’s when the guns raised Independence was a great struggle when each took their side, Soldiers were enlisted

item.title: Love
item.description: Love A wonderful thing indeed, Unable to be shown Can only be expressed But there is a deeper meaning for love That secret is the love between family And the never-ending love

item.title: Poems are Made
item.description: Poems are Made Poems are made because of the ideas Poems are made to remember the forgotten things Poems are made to burst out your happiness and make peace Poems are made to stop the miserable things that come in your heart

item.title: Friends!
item.description: When your small and new, there are friends for you, and there are friends for me, like you see so don’t fear to be just a friend.

item.title: The Hypnocycle
item.description: You never got yourself straight on a hypnocycle, Which feels like a bed, That ol’e hypnocycle will doze your self to sleep, Oh Joe, please don’t ride that again.

item.title: YUMMY FOOD!
Mother's Day!
item.description: The lovely greetings that you’ll see greetings great, show all your faith in anyone you’d like, you could do a hike, and always be happy.

item.title: LOVE
item.description: Love, Oh love, come back here and show yourself to my mom, I’d be happy if you’d be calm, Have fun, With your smile as bright as the sun.

item.title: Poem
item.description: I always want to improve when I always not sooth when I waste a lot of food in my very grumpy mood I always like to play and that’s what I say everyday.

item.title: My Poems
item.description: In the bright sunlight there were birds flying overhead and with the moonlight the owls spread their wings gracefully. I am I, I never change but my life does change.
